DOC.brief_summary: This is a single-institution, phase II study to determine the event-free survival at 1 year post allogeneic transplant and serial mesenchymal stem cell (MSC) infusions from a related donor (HLA identical, mismatched or haploidentical) or matched unrelated donor for the biochemical correction of severe epidermolysis bullosa (EB).
DOC.brief_title: MT2015-20: Biochemical Correction of Severe EB by Allo HSCT and Serial Donor MSCs
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of severe form of EB characterized by collagen, laminin, integrin, keratin or plakin deficiency (by immunofluorescence staining with protein specific antibodies or Western blotting and by mutation analysis). An available related donor (HLA identical, mismatched or haploidentical) or matched unrelated donor Adequate renal, hepatic, cardiac and pulmonary function Evidence of HIV infection or known HIV positive serology Current active serious infection Diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma Donor with EB Pregnancy or breast feeding
